1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Wednesday evenings take on a light-hearted touch as the The Dan Nicholl Show, hosted by celebrated presenter Dan Nicholl in partnership with BrightRock, will premiere on our screens this Wednesday, 1 April 2015 at 20:30 on SuperSport 1. Each week a trio of guests from the entertainment, lifestyle and sporting worlds will join Nicholl in-studio for a show that doesn't take itself too seriously, and will raise a smile from some of South Africa's more familiar faces. SHOW GUESTS: FRANCOIS PIENAAR 1995 Rugby World Cup-winning captain, Matt Damon-lookalike, and Lays crisps...

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: -- RYK NEETHLING is a South African swimmer born and bred in Bloemfontein, where he attended Grey College and excelled in swimming. Ryk earned a place in the South African swimming team for the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta and won an Olympic gold medal in the 4 x 100m freestyle relay at the 2004 Summer Olympics in Athens . After competing at the 2008 Summer Olympics, he become the first South African to participate in four successive Olympic Games. -- UNATHI MSENGANA is a South African musician, songwriter and radio personality. She is best known for hosting the ...

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: JOHN SMIT former rugby union player and currently chief executive officer of the Sharks. He was the 50th captain of the South African national team, the Springboks, and led the team to win the 2007 Rugby World Cup. He played most of his senior career as a hooker, but also won 13 caps as a prop, where he had also played for South Africa's under-21 team. He retired from international rugby following the 2011 Rugby World Cup as the most-capped South African player ever, with 111 appearances. CHEF BENNY MASEKWAMENG is one of the judges on the popular MasterChef South ...

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: -- ANDREW VAN ZYL His nickname is 'One Gear' and he was undefeated in seven bouts when he challenged Ruan Potts for the heavyweight title for the first time in November 2011 (he was defeated via first round submission). He then went on another winning tear and challenged Potts again for the title, claiming EFC gold via unanimous decision in a dominating five round war. He defended the belt successfully once against the dangerous striking of Sors Grobbelaar, but was beaten via submission in the trilogy bout with his rival Potts. Van Zyl has once again rebuilt himself ...

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: DAVID KIBUUKA is a Ugandan-born South African comedian best known as a field correspondent on the e.tv and eNews satirical show, Late Nite News with Loyiso Gola, since 2010. Other television shows he has appeared on include the Pure Monate Show, FONT, Laugh Out Loud, The Coconuts, Last Say on Sunday and Going Nowhere Slowly. A regular on the stand-up comedy circuit, David has performed at such events as the Kingsize Comedy Festival, Blacks Only and the Heavyweight Comedy Jam. He has also performed regularly at comedy venues like Tanz Café, Comedy Underground, Parkers ...

1.title: Miss SA and two lovestruck admirers!
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Episode #5.2
2.plot: This week Stormers hooker Skara Ntubeni and comedian Glen Biderman Pam join the show, along with Stuart Baxter, who may or may not be the new Bafana coach.

3.title: Episode #5.3
3.plot: Recently retired hockey player Sanani Mangisa and former Bafana striker Benni McCarthy are joined on this week's show by actor and comedian Robby Collins.

4.title: Episode #5.4
4.plot: This week Grant Lottering, the miracle cyclist who was declared dead but recovered remarkably to ride again, is joined by two very unlikely cousins - new Kaya FM breakfast host David O'Sullivan, and cricket superstar JP Duminy.

5.title: Episode #5.5
5.plot: A fortnight after the birth of his second son, Danny K escapes nappy duty to join us on the show, along with two of Durban's finest sportsmen - former Bundesliga star Delron Buckley, and new Proteas spinner Keshav Maharaj.

6.title: Eugene and the tough guys
6.plot: Little Eugene Khoza punches well above his weight on this week's show - particularly as the diminutive comedian is joined by madcap downhill mountain biker Stefan Garlicki, and Crusaders hard man Jordan Taufua.

7.title: The Bok, the Actress and Chris Bertish!
7.plot: This week on the show, Springbok Stefan Terblanche recalls a very special moment against the All Blacks with Joost van der Westhuizen, Hlubi Mboya celebrates her recent SAFTA award, and Chris Bertish reflects on his extraordinary journey across the Atlantic on a stand-up paddle board.

8.title: ProVerb and the Fast Men!
8.plot: Hip-hop artist and Idols host ProVerb joins Dan on the show this week, along with two very fast men - former Springbok wing Tonderai Chavhanga (who's now into pole dancing), and 15-year-old prodigy Stuwie White, a teenage racing driver who's too young to have a license.

9.title: The Chiefs Star, the Comic... and our Worst-Dressed Guest!
9.plot: This week's show sees Dan host Kaizer Chiefs and Bafana defender Lorenzo Gordinho, comedian and talk show host Jason Goliath, and the eccentrically dressed John McInroy, the former hockey international who started Red Sock Friday and The Unogwaja.

10.title: Cecil and the Travellers!
10.plot: This week the greatest points scorer in Blitzboks history, Cecil Afrika, joins two compulsive travelers - former Top Billing presenter Janez Vermeiren, now hosting M-Net's hit travel show Wingin' It, and adventurer Ron Rutland, preparing to depart for Mongolia to take on The Longest Hole.

11.title: Dane and the Maritzburg Boys!
11.plot: South Africa's cricket captain Dane van Niekerk joins us ahead of the upcoming Women's World Cup, along with two Maritzburg College old boys - rising South African hockey star Tyson Dlungwana, and the star of upcoming movie 'Van der Merwe', Rob van Vuuren.

12.title: Explorers, Comics and Loads of Boks!
12.plot: Who's on the show this week? Only @Springboks skipper Warren Whiteley and coach Allister Coetzee, adventurers Riaan Manser and Vasti Geldenhuys (back from the world's worst honeymoon), Players Fund beneficiary Dan Lombard, Bok front rowers Coenie Oosthuizen and Chilliboy Ralepelle, Team Dimension Data boss Doug Ryder, comedians Donovan Goliath and Eric Jansen, laid back lock forward Lood de Jager, and the only man to play for both the Springboks and Wallabies, Tiaan Strauss. All packed into a two-hour special edition of the show - enjoy.

13.title: Tumi and the Boys!
13.plot: It's our final show for season five, as we take a break until September - and what a cast list to wrap things up. Six-time PSL winner Daine Klate, actress, comedian and new Jacaranda breakfast host Tumi Morake, and South African water polo captain Pierre le Roux join us, with a cameo from Saracens star Schalk Brits.

1.title: Cricket, Football, and 20 Years of Comedy!
1.plot: Season six of the show gets going this week, and what a way to start - football star Steven Schillo Pienaar, cricketer Dean Elgar and comedian David Kau join Dan, who also spends some time in Mauritius with Laureus South Africa. 7pm on Wednesday night on SuperSport 1 - enjoy.

2.title: #6.2 Minki, her husband, and Robbie Flair!
2.plot: This week on the show, Boer Soek 'n Vrou host Minki van der Westhuizen joins us with her husband, Saracens legend Ernst Joubert, and one of cricket's great character, Robin Peterson.

3.title: #6.3 Jeannie, Sibusiso, and Bert's beautiful boy!
3.plot: This week on the show, Jeannie D recalls trying to seduce Liam Neeson, Sibusiso Vilane explains why there's a mountain in Alaska he'll never go back to, and Chad le Clos looks back at a career that's a long way from over - and dad Bert makes a cameo appearance.

4.title: #6.4 This week: superstars in Scotland!
4.plot: We're in Scotland for this week's show, catching up with some huge names at the Alfred Dunhill Links Championship - cricketers Mark Nicholas and Shane Warne, golfer Brandon Stone, Westlife's Bryan McFadden, Huey Lewis (of 'The News'), and Bon Jovi's Tico Torres.

5.title: #6.5 Barry Richards and the athletes!
5.plot: This week, cricket great Barry Richards, who once scored 325 in a single day; comedian Chris Forrest, who used to be an athletics coach (sort of); and Ruswahl Samaai, Africa's reigning long jump champion.

6.title: #6.6 Dom and the boys!
6.plot: This week, South Africa's Arkansas-based Olympic runner Dominique Scott teams up with one of comedy's rising stars, Loyiso Madinga, and BMW racing driver Gennaro Bonafede.

7.title: Ross, Morgan and the Soapie King!
7.plot: This week's guests are Lions and Springbok scrumhalf Ross Cronje, SuperSport United and Bafana Bafana defender Morgan Gould, and the man who's been in every soap opera ever made in South Africa (we think) - Emmanuel Castis.

8.title: The Chef, the Mountaineer and the Expectant Dad!
8.plot: This week on the show, we're joined by former South African Chef of the Year, chef patron at Marble, and host of M-Net's hit show My Kitchen Rules, David Higgs; mountaineer Deshun Deysel, 21 years after her first expedition to Everest; and James Cunnama, back from a top five finish at the Ironman World Championships in Hawaii.

9.title: The Scrumhalf, the Rapper and the Mongolian Caddie!
9.plot: This week Dan is joined by former Stormers, Saracens and Springboks scrumhalf Neil de Kock, rising hip hop star Rouge, and intrepid adventurer Ron Rutland, fresh from a groundbreaking trip across Mongolia playing The Longest Hole.

10.title: Kagiso, DJ S'bu and Fearless PJ!
10.plot: This week Dan is joined by fearsome Lions and Proteas fast bowler Kagiso Rabada, entrepreneur, musician and radio personality DJ S'bu, and Patrick Sweeney, who left corporate America, beat Leukemia, and become the first person to cycle to Everest base camp.

11.title: Cassper, Marcelle and the Miracle Man!
11.plot: This week on The Dan Nicholl Show, hip hop star Cassper Nyovest talks about his plan to fill up the FNB Stadium on December 2, Marcelle Keet juggles playing water polo and hockey for South Africa, and Springbok prop Julian Redelinghuys recalls the day he broke his neck playing rugby.

12.title: #6.12 Tracey Lee and the Golfers!
12.plot: This week actress, singer and comedian Tracey Lee Oliver joins Dan on the show, along with two golfers - professional Ashleigh Buhai, on the back of her best ever season on the LPGA Tour, and amateur Chris Morris, who plays as much golf as he can when he's not playing cricket for the Titans or South Africa.

13.title: #6.13 Nomzamo and the Sportsmen!
13.plot: After a year that's included hosting the red carpet at the BET Awards in New York, actress and presenter Nomzamo Mbatha joins the final episode of season six, along with Blitzboks star Dylan Sage, and Proteas opening batsman Aiden Markram.

1.title: Lungi, Ndumiso and Pastor Pierre
1.plot: Fast bowler Lungi Ngidi and the dilemma of wanting selfies with his new team-mates, comedian Ndumiso Lindi carrying bags for Makhaya Ntini at school, and former Springbok Pierre Spies swapping rugby for the church.

2.title: The Hong Kong Sevens special edition!
2.plot: Dan is in Hong Kong this week, with a very special edition of the show from the Park Lane Hotel, featuring legendary All Black Mils Muliaina, Wallaby hard man Justin Harrison, and the man coaching the Blitzboks at the Hong Kong Sevens this week, Marius Schoeman.

3.title: The Magic Man, the Kiwi and Limpopo's finest!
3.plot: Dan is joined by South Africa's new UFC signing Don Madge, headed to Liverpool in May for his first fight; New Zealand striker Jeremy Brockie, leading the attack at Sundowns; and comedian Bongani Dube, one of the stars of Trevor Noah's new comedy show.

4.title: Pearl Thusi and the running men!
4.plot: Actress Pearl Thusi talks about her two new movies; Henricho Bruintjies celebrates his two silver medals at the Commonwealth Games; and Ryan Sandes is happy to be alive after running the Great Himalayan Trail.

5.title: Ryk, Aphiwe and the dancing singer!
5.plot: Ryk Neethling explains his new role at the Princess Charlene of Monaco Foundation; Lions winger Aphiwe Dyantyi talks about making it big in Super Rugby, and singer Connell Cruise celebrates winning the Dancing With The Stars South Africa.

6.title: The swimmer, the cricketer and the sangoma's daughter!
6.plot: Double Commonwealth Games gold medallist Tatjana Schoenmaker looks back, Laura Wolvaardt juggles cricket, musical and medical studies, and Khanyisa Bunu swapped teaching for comedy.

7.title: It's Dean Furman's bachelor party!
7.plot: SuperSport United skipper and Bafana midfielder Dean Furman is getting married, so this week's show is his bachelor party - with Food Network star Jenny Morris and football-mad Cobras coach Ashwell Prince along for the ride.

8.title: Rob, Kurt and the cricketing magician!
8.plot: Former Springbok Rob Louw talks about his battle with cancer, comedian Kurt Schoonraad looks forward to The Dan Nicholl Show Comedy Festival in Cape Town, and Proteas cricketer Tabraiz Shamsi pulls off a magic trick.

9.title: The actor, the cricketer and the rugby-playing footballer!
9.plot: Comedian and actor Paul Snodgrass discusses two short films he stars in, cricketer Jacques Rudolph plays matchmaker for his mum, and Ryan Moon explains that playing for Kaizer Chiefs doesn't tie in with his original sport of choice.

10.title: The accountant, the policeman and the doctor!
10.plot: On the show this week, accountant Thulisa Keyi, who's also Miss South Africa runner-up; policeman Rory Steyn, who used to look after Madiba's security; and doctor Tamaryn Green, who is our brand new Miss South Africa.

11.title: Amanda, Polly and 7de Laan's finest!
11.plot: Amanda Dlamini looks back on 105 caps for Banyana Banyana, Shaun Pollock reflects on his own extraordinary international career, and Dan tries very hard to get Survivor host Nico Panagio to reveal who wins.

12.title: Cameron van der Burgh's bachelor party!
12.plot: Olympic gold medallist Cameron van der Burgh prepares for his wedding in Athens, actress and comedian Krijay Govender looks ahead to the Big 5 comedy show in Durban, and Keagan Dolly reports back on playing against Neymar in France.

13.title: Malcolm, Maps and Jonty!
13.plot: The final episode wraps up in style - Springbok hooker Malcolm Marx, actor presenter and entrepreneur Maps Maponyane and cricket icon Jonty Rhodes join Dan in studio, with cameos from Kevin Pietersen, and all three of the Goliath's.

14.title: Saving rhino with Kevin Pietersen!
14.plot: In a special edition of the show from the Kruger National Park, Kevin Pietersen shares his passion for conservation and the fight against rhino poaching, with good friends Amit Bhatia, Butch James and Mark Boucher.
